title: Angels We Have Heard on High

author.name: Traditional French Carol
author.bio: The hymn 'Angels We Have Heard on High' is a traditional French carol known for its beautiful and joyous melody, often sung during Christmas time to celebrate the birth of Jesus Christ.

lyrics:
1. Angels we have heard on high,
Sweetly singing o'er the plains
And the mountain in reply,
Echo back their joyous strains.

CHORUS:
Gloria in excelsis Deo
Gloria in excelsis Deo.

2. Shepherds why this jubilee?
Why your joyous strains prolong?
Say what may the tidings be
Which inspire your Heav'nly song?

3. Come to Bethlehem and see,
Him whose birth the Angels sing,
Come adore on bended knee,
Christ the Lord the newborn King.

4. See within a manger laid,
Jesus, Lord of Heav'n and Earth
Mary Joseph lend your aid,
With us sing our Saviour's birth.
